de.hsbremen.tc.tnc.message.util

Class DefaultByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hsbremen.tc.tnc.message.util.DefaultByteBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteBuffer

    public class DefaultByteBuffer
extends Object
implements ByteBuffer
    Default byte buffer backed by a list of arrays to overcome the size limitations of a usual Java byte buffer. It can theoretically allocate MAX_INT*MAX_INT bytes, because it uses long for size related functions the maximum capacity is MAX_LONG. The capacity is allocated in chunks as soon as needed and not at once to prevent unnecessary memory allocation.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultByteBuffer(long capacity)
      Creates the buffer with the given capacity and a default chunk size of MAX_INT.
      DefaultByteBuffer(long capacity, int chunkSize)
      Creates the buffer with the given capacity and the given chunk size used to allocate memory.

      • revertWrite

        public long revertWrite(long length)
        Description copied from interface: ByteBuffer
        Resets the write pointer about the given length of bytes. The new position is bytes written minus length. If the read pointer is larger than the new position, the pointer is set too, that write pointer == read pointer. If the write pointer is smaller than the given length, both pointers are set to zero. Revert write discards all bytes, that are within the reverted length.
        Specified by:
        revertWrite in interface ByteBuffer
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to step back
        Returns:
        the new position of the write pointer

      • revertRead

        public long revertRead(long length)
        Description copied from interface: ByteBuffer
        Resets the read pointer about the given length of bytes. The new position is bytes read minus length. If the read pointer is smaller than the given length, the pointer is set to zero. No bytes will be discarded by this operation.
        Specified by:
        revertRead in interface ByteBuffer
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to step back
        Returns:
        the new position of the write pointer

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Description copied from interface: ByteBuffer
        Clears the buffer. The buffer will be empty after this operation an all pointers will be zero.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface ByteBuffer

      • bytesWritten

        public long bytesWritten()
        Description copied from interface: ByteBuffer
        Returns the bytes currently written to the buffer. If the buffer capacity is larger than MAX_LONG and the number of bytes written is larger than MAX_LONG or the buffer is not writable -1 is returned.
        Specified by:
        bytesWritten in interface ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        the written bytes count
